source.author: Jeanes, J.A.
source.title: Asteraceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Jeanes, J.A. (1999). Asteraceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: leaves discolorous, green above, white- cobwebbed below
leaves concolorous, green or grey-green on both surfaces
Capitula cylindric, less than 2 cm diam.; corollas mostly 10–17 mm long
Capitula hemispherical, 2–5 cm diam.; corollas mostly 18–22 mm long
Dorsal surface of intermediate involucral bracts covered with minute antrorse hairs; outer florets exceeding adjacent inner involucral bracts; inner cypselas yellow-fawn; capitula usually 1–3
Dorsal surface of intermediate involucral bracts glabrous or very sparsely hairy; outer florets not exceeding adjacent inner involucral bracts; inner cypselas grey- brown; capitula usually 3–9
